result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda R Lardinois was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing December 1, 2015 and each 1st of the month thereafter until paid in full.  There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample and make arrangements with the Washington County Sheriff's Department withint 3 days to provide the sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amanda R Lardinois

defendant.name: Lardinois, Amanda R

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).

Def in person & by Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Guilty plea entered.  Court finds def guilty and orders a fine of $579.00 (DNA) to be paid at a rate of $25.00 per month commencing 12-1-15 or judgment shall be entered for nonpayment.   There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered. Court orders DNA sample arrangements be made within 3 days with the WCSD.
Def in person & by Atty  State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Counsel just appointed.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Def appears in custody by video from Washington Co Jail & w/Atty Alyssa Armbrust State Public Defenders Office.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  SPD unable to do the evaluation.  State does not oppose a signature bond and defendant has an active temporary felony warrant in Outagamie County, counsel cannot make an argument as was unable to discuss matter with defendant due to health issue.  Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 09:45 am.
